category.name: Design
category.description: Master design principles, user experience, and visual communication skills.

sub_categories.name: UI/UX Design
sub_categories.description: Learn user interface and user experience design principles and best practices.

exercises.title: Design Fundamentals
exercises.description: Learn fundamental design principles and basic UI/UX concepts.

tasks.title: CSS Layout Basics
tasks.question:
Create a responsive navigation bar using HTML and CSS.

Your navigation should:

  • Have a logo on the left
  • Include navigation links (Home, About, Services, Contact)
  • Be responsive (mobile-friendly)
  • Use flexbox for layout
  • Have hover effects on links
tasks.hint: Use flexbox with justify-content: space-between for main layout, media queries for mobile
tasks.input: Navigation bar with logo and 4 links
tasks.output: Responsive navigation with flexbox layout and hover effects

tasks.title: Visual Hierarchy
tasks.question:
What is the primary purpose of visual hierarchy in UI design?

Consider: How users scan and process information on a page
tasks.hint: Think about guiding user attention and organizing content
options: To make the design colorful - aesthetic appeal
To guide user attention and organize content importance
To reduce loading time - performance optimization
To increase text readability - typography focus

tasks.title: Color Scheme Implementation
tasks.question:
Create a color scheme using CSS custom properties (variables) for a website.

Your color scheme should:

  • Define primary, secondary, and accent colors
  • Include light and dark variants
  • Use CSS custom properties
  • Apply colors to different elements
  • Ensure good contrast ratios
tasks.hint: Use :root to define CSS variables, then apply them to elements with good contrast
tasks.output: CSS variables defined and applied to elements with proper contrast

tasks.title: User-Centered Design
tasks.question:
What is the core principle of user-centered design?

Consider: Who the design is created for
tasks.hint: Think about putting users first in the design process
options: Design for designers - aesthetic focus
Design for users - understand their needs and goals
Design for technology - technical constraints
Design for business - profit maximization

tasks.title: Button Component Design
tasks.question:
Create a reusable button component with different states.

Your button should:

  • Have default, hover, active, and disabled states
  • Use consistent styling and spacing
  • Be accessible (proper ARIA labels)
  • Support different sizes (small, medium, large)
  • Include smooth transitions
tasks.hint: Use CSS pseudo-classes (:hover, :active, :disabled) and transitions for smooth state changes
tasks.input: Button with text 'Submit' and different states
tasks.output: Accessible button component with hover, active, and disabled states

tasks.title: Accessibility in Design
tasks.question:
What is the purpose of ARIA labels in web design?

Consider: How screen readers interpret web content
tasks.hint: Think about making content accessible to users with disabilities
options: To make text larger - visual accessibility
To provide context for screen readers - assistive technology
To improve SEO - search engine optimization
To reduce loading time - performance

exercises.title: User Experience Basics
exercises.description: Understand basic UX concepts and user research fundamentals.

tasks.title: Form Design
tasks.question:
Design a user-friendly contact form with proper UX practices.

Your form should:

  • Include name, email, and message fields
  • Have clear labels and placeholders
  • Show validation errors appropriately
  • Be responsive and accessible
  • Have a clear call-to-action button
tasks.hint: Use semantic HTML, proper form validation, and clear error messaging
tasks.input: Contact form with name, email, message fields
tasks.output: Accessible form with validation and responsive design

tasks.title: User Journey Mapping
tasks.question:
What is the purpose of user journey mapping in UX design?

Consider: Understanding user interactions with a product
tasks.hint: Think about visualizing the user's experience over time
options: To create beautiful graphics - visual design
To understand user emotions and pain points throughout their experience
To reduce development costs - budget planning
To improve website speed - performance optimization

tasks.title: Loading State Design
tasks.question:
Create a loading state component with skeleton screens.

Your loading state should:

  • Show skeleton placeholders for content
  • Use subtle animations
  • Match the actual content layout
  • Provide visual feedback
  • Be accessible to screen readers
tasks.hint: Use CSS animations with @keyframes for skeleton loading effects
tasks.input: Skeleton loading for a card component
tasks.output: Animated skeleton loading with proper accessibility

tasks.title: Usability Testing
tasks.question:
What is the main goal of usability testing?

Consider: Testing with real users to identify problems
tasks.hint: Think about finding issues before final release
options: To make the design beautiful - aesthetic improvement
To identify usability problems and improve user experience
To reduce development time - efficiency
To increase website traffic - marketing

tasks.title: Error State Design
tasks.question:
Design an error state component for a web application.

Your error state should:

  • Clearly communicate the error
  • Provide helpful next steps
  • Use appropriate visual design
  • Include a way to recover
  • Be user-friendly and not intimidating
tasks.hint: Use clear messaging, helpful actions, and non-threatening visual design
tasks.output: User-friendly error page with clear messaging and recovery options

tasks.title: Information Architecture
tasks.question:
What is information architecture in UX design?

Consider: How information is organized and structured
tasks.hint: Think about organizing content for easy navigation
options: The visual design of information - graphics
The organization and structure of information for easy navigation
The technical implementation - coding
The marketing strategy - promotion
